block-definition.s: Speak %'message' $nl using the MARY text-to-speech service $nl with voice %'voice' $nl with volume %'volume' $nl wait %'wait' before doing the next command
block-definition.comment: Says message using 'voice' (number or name). 'Volume' is between 0 and 1. Will wait until the speaking is finished if 'wait' is true.

custom-block.s: run eCraft2Learn command %txt with %mult%s
run eCraft2Learn command %txt with %mult%s

block-definition.comment: Reports the first voice number that matches all the arguments. If nothing matches tries to find a voice that matches the first argument.

custom-block.s: wait until voices load (if any)
call eCraft2Learn reporter %txt with %mult%s
check for voices %cmdRing if no voices otherwise do %cmdRing

block-definition.s: check for voices %'do if no voices' if no voices otherwise do %'do if voices'

custom-block.s: run eCraft2Learn command %txt with %mult%s
voices loaded (if there are any)

block-definition.s: Speak %'message' then %'to do when finished speaking'

custom-block.s: run eCraft2Learn command %txt with %mult%s

block-definition.comment: Use the browser's default voice or Mary TTS to speak the 'message'.

custom-block.s: run eCraft2Learn command %txt with %mult%s
let %upvar be %s
Speak %txt then %cmdRing
call eCraft2Learn reporter %txt with %mult%s

block-definition.s: Speak %'message' $nl with pitch %'pitch' $nl with rate %'rate' $nl with voice %'voice' $nl with volume %'volume' $nl in language %'language' $nl wait %'wait' before doing the next command
block-definition.comment: Speaks 'message'. Optionally you can provide the pitch (a positive number), rate (a number between .1 and 2), voice name or number (depends upon what voices are accessible from the browser - see 'get voice names'), volume (a positive number), and language code or name. This command will wait until it is finished if wait is true.

custom-block.s: run eCraft2Learn command %txt with %mult%s

block-definition.comment: Stops the current attempt to recognize what is spoken.

custom-block.s: run eCraft2Learn command %txt with %mult%s

block-definition.s: Listen to the microphone $nl %'handle response' when recognition completes $nl but if error %'handle error' with error message
block-definition.comment: Listens to the microphone for speech. The first script is run with the recognized text unless an error is encountered then the second script is called with text describing the error.

custom-block.s: run eCraft2Learn command %txt with %mult%s

block-definition.s: Listen to the microphone $nl %'respond as heard' as words are recognised $nl %'handle final response' when recognition completes $nl but if error %'handle error' with error message $nl with language %'language' $nl with %'max alternatives' maximum number of alternatives $nl %'handle alternatives' with the list of alternative recognitions $nl %'handle confidences' with the list of confidences
block-definition.comment: As words are recognised 'respond as heard' is passed what the recogniser thinks it has heard. When it thinks you are finished speaking the 'handle final response' is given the final text. If an error occurs such as 'no-speech' then the error description is given to 'handle error'. 'language' can be its code or name. You can ask for a list of alternative responses to what was spoken that contains at most 'max alternatives'. 'handle alternatives' is given a list of alternatives. 'handle confidences' is given a list of numbers between 0 and 1 where 1 is certainty.

custom-block.s: run eCraft2Learn command %txt with %mult%s

block-definition.s: Broadcast speech recognition results and report any errors %'report'
block-definition.comment: When something is spoken this broadcasts 'heard something' and sets 'last thing spoken' to the text that was spoken. You will need to create two new variables for this to work: 'last thing spoken' and 'speech recognition error'. Optionally reports errors. The 'stop speech recognition' block will stop the listening as will silence that triggers a 'no-speech' error.

custom-block.s: Listen to the microphone %br %cmdRing when recognition completes %br but if error %cmdRing with error message
Broadcast speech recognition results and report any errors %b

block.l: I didn't hear anything for a while. Bye. Click the green flag to start listening again.

list.l: . Click the green flag to try again.

block-definition.s: Train with audio buckets %'bucket names' labels $nl add to any earlier training %'add to previous training' $nl optionally add this text to the page %'introduction' $nl then %'do when ready' when returning from training
block-definition.comment: Will display a panel where one can train the system to classify sounds or speech. 'bucket names' are the labels of the classes to train. Optionally one can provide HTML to appear on the page as an introduction. If 'do when ready' is provided those commands will be run when returning to Snap!

custom-block.s: run eCraft2Learn command %txt with %mult%s
%txt panel visible

block-definition.comment: Reports the last thing spoken or if there was an error the error message. Note that "no-speech" is an error message while if spoken it will be "no speech". NOTE that this waits for something to be spoken or enough time has passed.

custom-block.s: Listen to the microphone %br %cmdRing when recognition completes %br but if error %cmdRing with error message
run eCraft2Learn command %txt with %mult%s

block-definition.comment: Language to use for speech input and output only if no language or voice is specified. Can be the language name in English or itself. Or the official code for the language such as fr-FR for French in France. Also used as the default language for the word embedding blocks.

custom-block.s: run eCraft2Learn command %txt with %mult%s

block-definition.comment: Reports whether the selected support panel is visible.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet

custom-block.s: call eCraft2Learn reporter %txt with %mult%s

block-definition.comment: As it recognises what is spoken it passes the list of label confidences to the 'process confidences' input. If model is "Pre-trained model of 20 words" then it will recognise 'zero', 'one', 'two', 'three', 'four', 'five', 'six', 'seven', 'eight', 'nine', 'up', 'down', 'left', 'right', 'go', 'stop', 'yes', and 'no', Alternatively if model is "User-trained model" then the model trained by running the "Train with audio buckets" block will be used. Use the 'stop listening for audio label confidences' block to stop this.

inputs.input: User-trained modelPre-trained model of 20 words User-trained model

custom-block.s: run eCraft2Learn command %txt with %mult%s

block-definition.s: Load microphone training data from URL %'URL' then %'do after loading'
block-definition.comment: Loads in the training created using the 'Train with audio buckets ..." block where the saved training has been copied to a web server.

custom-block.s: show message %txt for %s seconds
run eCraft2Learn command %txt with %mult%s
show message %txt for %s seconds

block-definition.s: Load microphone training data from file then %'after loading training data'
block-definition.comment: Loads in the training created using the 'Train with audio buckets ..." block . It prompts for the file.

custom-block.s: show message %txt for %s seconds
run eCraft2Learn command %txt with %mult%s
show message %txt for %s seconds

block-definition.comment: Open an interface page for different machine learning models.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet tensorflow.js

custom-block.s: run eCraft2Learn command %txt with %mult%s
run eCraft2Learn command %txt with %mult%s

block-definition.s: Get predictions using Teachable Machine audio model %'URL' $nl and process each word recognised %'process word predictions' $nl or else if there is an error %'do if error'

custom-block.s: Load eCraft2Learn library
load tensorflow
run eCraft2Learn command %txt with %mult%s
run eCraft2Learn command %txt with %mult%s
Open web page %txt

block-definition.s: Stop listening for audio label confidences
block-definition.comment: If any of the blocks listening for speech or sounds are running this stops them.

custom-block.s: run eCraft2Learn command %txt with %mult%s
load eCraft2Learn
run eCraft2Learn command %txt with %mult%s
Load eCraft2Learn library
run eCraft2Learn command %txt with %mult%s
load eCraft2Learn

block-definition.comment: No longer needed in Snap! 7+ but retained to avoid error from blocks that expect it.
